tweets.text:
We have issued a severe #flood warning for #EastDidsbury #WestDidsbury and #Northenden which means a threat to life and significant disruption. 
We are working with the emergency services to keep communities to keep people safe. Updates ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV https://t.co/Ue0KEP0snL

It‚Äôs wet, wet, wet across the #Midlands today (Wednesday). Lots of surface water on roads. Please don‚Äôt drive through #flood water. 30cms is enough to float your car. Keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here 
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/fMneKq3b7w

We are expecting river levels on the River Ouse in York to peak on Friday morning at around 4.6-4.8m. We continue to monitor the situation. Please stay safe and don‚Äôt walk, drive or cycle through flood water #floodaware https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/ZAEZaCPKhb

‚ö†Ô∏è @gmpolice & @EnvAgencyNW have announced a Severe Flood Warning covering parts of Didsbury, Chorlton & Northenden as levels of the River Mersey rise. ‚ö†Ô∏è 

A Severe Flood Warning means we must act now & evacuations have started, focusing on those most vulnerable first.

1/7 https://t.co/x23iGk7ydC

Once again Parkgate Road is closed due to flooding from Finchett's Gutter & the Highfield Drain. A few houses at risk plus @AldiUK (we did warn them). The flood lagoon by the @CountessPark is full & the #CountessCountryPark is well under in places, please avoid.
@GPorterStandard https://t.co/QdzpgwouGv

tweets.text: Severe flood warnings issued for West Didsbury and Northenden meaning the @EnvAgencyNW thinks there‚Äôs a danger to life. https://t.co/uvTR5U5qto

Two SEVERE FLOOD WARNINGS have been issued by the @EnvAgency

‚Äî River Mersey at East Didsbury
‚Äî River Mersey at West Didsbury & Northenden

Evacuation plans are now underway with an imminent danger to life & property.

#StormChristoph https://t.co/jqE5uTwOzT

Our field team was in Old Denaby today putting up temporary barriers to ensure access to the Covid vaccination site is maintained in case of any impacts of flooding from the #RiverDon https://t.co/hLC6LMgL3I

We have been bolstering the repairs we are currently making to Temple Manor wash lands in the Lower Aire today, as they fill up due to snowmelt and rainfall. Stay #floodaware and check the flood warnings where you live https://t.co/3UGLsuUejh

UPDATE: 7.30pm: Wet & windy day @EnvAgencyYNE @Calderdale defences tested, river & canal been high. Amber warning remains in place, but stabilising & levels reducing. Warning ICE from 0100 as rains ease. Outstanding effort #teamcalderdale inc @slowtheflow_UK #StormChristoph üôè

entity.name: Springwatch
entity.description: Following the fortunes of a cast of unforgettable wildlife characters at the climax of spring.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

entity.name: Winterwatch

Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

tweets.text: River levels in Calderdale are still responding to current rainfall and will remain high in the upper parts of the catchment. We continue to monitor the situation . Stay #floodaware and check flood warnings in your area https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/aW7k7fp5PE

tweets.text:
With flood warnings across the country caused by Storm Christoph, make sure you're prepared by following the @EnvAgency's Prepare, Act, Survive advice. 
#REACTDisasterResponse #floodwarning #StormChristoph

urls.title: Flooding advice
urls.description: Information available to help customers before, during and after a flood situation.

tweets.text: Our engineers have been out to Palentine Road in #Didsbury earlier today to add sandbags around our substation to protect the network from any potential flooding. We're continuing to keep a close eye on things alongside @EnvAgencyNW üëâhttps://t.co/XfuX7fDCfG https://t.co/eZ0gctVHbh

urls.title: Flood warnings issued for Sheffield
urls.description: After raining heavily through the night, we are not expecting any more heavy rainfall in the coming days. A few local surface water issues were attended to but there are no flood warnings in place and no major issues on the roads. Water levels are reducing and we expect the 5 flood alerts in place (Blackburn Brook, Middle River Don, River Sheaf & Porter Brook, Upper Derwent and Upper River Don catchment) to be removed at some point today. For the latest flooding updates visit: https://www.gov.uk/check-floo

tweets.text: With rain expected throughout the day and into tomorrow, we are continuing to monitor river levels & respond to any reports of localised flooding. Please stay at home & only travel if it's essential üåßÔ∏è More at: https://t.co/qsJpHI5HxV https://t.co/h2fZuRxtBu
@Jenni_dyson @EnvAgencyYNE Hydrometry - similar to this I expect? https://t.co/rIDFkxCnus
